articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pounded Rafah and other areas across the Gaza Strip and engaged in close-quarter combat with fighters led by Palestinian Islamist group Hamas, residents and Israel's military said.
articles.title: Israeli forces step up bombardment across Gaza, amid fierce fighting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Regular puffs of smoke from missile intercepts over northern Israel and fires from air strikes in southern Lebanon are outward signs of a fear that the Gaza war may be expanding into a wider conflict, which analysts say poses risks for both sides.
articles.title: Israel and Hezbollah faceoff raises risk of wider conflict

articles.author: Greg Torode, Gerry Doyle, Laurie Chen
articles.description: The United States and China resumed semi-official nuclear arms talks in March for the first time in five years, with Beijing's representatives telling U.S. counterparts that they would not resort to atomic threats over Taiwan, according to two American delegates who attended.
articles.title: Exclusive: U.S. and China hold first informal nuclear talks in 5 years, eyeing Taiwan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia sees a pressing need for security talks with the United States but they must be "comprehensive" and include the subject of Ukraine, the Kremlin said on Friday.
articles.title: Russia tells US: we need to talk, but Ukraine must be on agenda

articles.author: Layli Foroudi, Manuel Ausloos
articles.description: In a racially mixed suburb of Paris, left-wing parliamentary candidate Adel Amara campaigned door-to-door one evening this week, saying he worries for France's minority communities if Marine Le Pen's far-right National Rally (RN) wins the coming election.
articles.title: French alliance seeks to counter voter apathy, turn a Paris suburb leftward

articles.author: Joan Faus
articles.description: Barcelona, a top Spanish holiday destination, announced on Friday that it will bar apartment rentals to tourists by 2028, an unexpectedly drastic move as it seeks to rein in soaring housing costs and make the city liveable for residents.
articles.title: Top tourist destination Barcelona plans to shut all holiday apartments by 2028

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: One person was killed and at least 200 people injured across Kenya in Thursday's nationwide protests against government plans to raise $2.7 billion in additional taxes, an alliance of rights groups and the police watchdog said.
articles.title: One person killed, over 200 injured in Kenya tax protests

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Montenegro, Bosnia and most of Croatia's Adriatic coast where temperatures approached 104 degrees Fahrenheit (40°C), experienced a major power blackout on Friday, according to Montenegro power distributor CEDIS and local media.
articles.title: Power blackout hits Montenegro, Bosnia, Albania and Croatia's Adriatic coast

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Monsoon rains and upstream river water from India have caused widespread flooding in northeastern Bangladesh, stranding more than 2 million people, and the situation could worsen, officials said on Friday.
articles.title: Floods ravage parts of Bangladesh, strand over 2 million people

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine believes a second summit to consider Kyiv's proposals for peace with Russia could be hosted by a country in the Global South, a senior official was quoted as saying by the Interfax-Ukraine news agency on Friday.
articles.title: Ukraine says Global South nation could host second peace summit
